# Cre8 Design System - AI Agent Instructions

## Overview

Cre8 is a design system available as Web Components (`@tmorrow/cre8-wc`) and React (`@tmorrow/cre8-react`). This MCP server provides component intelligence for AI-assisted development.

## Quick Start

### MCP Connection (Claude Desktop)
```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "cre8": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "cre8-mcp"]
    }
  }
}
```

### Available Tools
- `list_components` - List all components by category
- `get_component` - Get detailed component info (props, slots, events, CSS vars)
- `get_patterns` - Get pre-built UI patterns
- `search_components` - Search by name/description

## Component Formats

### Web Components (Default)
Use kebab-case tag names and attributes:
```html
<cre8-button text="Submit" variant="primary" full-width></cre8-button>
<cre8-field label="Email" type="email" error-note="Required"></cre8-field>
<cre8-card>
  <cre8-heading type="h2">Title</cre8-heading>
  <p>Content goes here</p>
</cre8-card>
```

Import: `import '@tmorrow/cre8-wc/cre8-button';`

### React Components
Use PascalCase component names and camelCase props:
```jsx
<Cre8Button text="Submit" variant="primary" fullWidth />
<Cre8Field label="Email" type="email" errorNote="Required" />
<Cre8Card>
  <Cre8Heading type="h2">Title</Cre8Heading>
  <p>Content goes here</p>
</Cre8Card>
```

Import: `import { Cre8Button } from '@tmorrow/cre8-react';`

## Web Component API Structure

Each web component exposes:

### Attributes (HTML)
Reflected properties settable via HTML attributes. Use kebab-case.
Example: `<cre8-button full-width disabled></cre8-button>`

### Properties (JS)
JavaScript-only properties for complex types.
Example: `element.iconSvg = svgElement;`

### Slots
Named content projection points.
- `default` - Main content
- Named slots like `header`, `footer`, `icon`

Example:
```html
<cre8-card>
  <span slot="header">Card Title</span>
  Main content here
  <div slot="footer">Footer actions</div>
</cre8-card>
```

### Events
Custom events with detail payloads. Always prefixed with `cre8-`.
- `cre8-click` - Button clicks
- `cre8-change` - Input value changes
- `cre8-toggle` - Accordion/disclosure toggle

Example: `element.addEventListener('cre8-change', (e) => console.log(e.detail.value));`

### CSS Custom Properties
Component-level design tokens for styling customization.

Example:
```css
cre8-button {
  --cre8-button-background: #custom-color;
  --cre8-button-border-radius: 8px;
}
```

## Component Categories

1. **Actions** - Button, DangerButton
2. **Forms** - Field, Select, Checkbox, Radio, DatePicker
3. **Layout** - Card, Grid, Section, Hero, Band, Divider
4. **Typography** - Heading, TextPassage, TextLink
5. **Navigation** - Tabs, Breadcrumbs, Pagination, GlobalNav
6. **Disclosure** - Accordion, Modal, Dropdown, Tooltip, Popover
7. **Feedback** - Alert, Badge, LoadingSpinner, ProgressMeter
8. **Data** - Table, List, Tag, Chart
9. **Media** - Icon, Logo
10. **Marketing** - Feature, PageHeader

## Common Patterns

### Form with Validation
```html
<cre8-card>
  <cre8-heading type="h2">Sign Up</cre8-heading>
  <cre8-field label="Email" type="email" required></cre8-field>
  <cre8-field label="Password" type="password" required></cre8-field>
  <cre8-button text="Create Account" variant="primary" full-width></cre8-button>
</cre8-card>
```

### Data Table
```html
<cre8-table striped hoverable>
  <cre8-table-header>
    <cre8-table-row>
      <cre8-table-header-cell>Name</cre8-table-header-cell>
      <cre8-table-header-cell>Status</cre8-table-header-cell>
    </cre8-table-row>
  </cre8-table-header>
  <cre8-table-body>
    <cre8-table-row>
      <cre8-table-cell>Item 1</cre8-table-cell>
      <cre8-table-cell><cre8-badge text="Active" variant="success"></cre8-badge></cre8-table-cell>
    </cre8-table-row>
  </cre8-table-body>
</cre8-table>
```

### Page Layout
```html
<cre8-layout>
  <cre8-header sticky>
    <cre8-global-nav>
      <span slot="logo"><cre8-logo></cre8-logo></span>
      <cre8-global-nav-item href="/">Home</cre8-global-nav-item>
    </cre8-global-nav>
  </cre8-header>
  <main>
    <cre8-layout-container>
      <!-- Page content -->
    </cre8-layout-container>
  </main>
  <cre8-footer></cre8-footer>
</cre8-layout>
```

## Design Tokens

Global CSS custom properties available:

### Colors
- `--cre8-color-primary` - Primary brand color
- `--cre8-color-secondary` - Secondary color
- `--cre8-color-background` - Page background
- `--cre8-color-surface` - Card/component surface
- `--cre8-color-text` - Primary text
- `--cre8-color-border` - Default borders
- `--cre8-color-error` / `success` / `warning` / `info` - Status colors

### Spacing
- `--cre8-spacing-xs` (4px) through `--cre8-spacing-2xl` (48px)

### Typography
- `--cre8-font-size-xs` (12px) through `--cre8-font-size-3xl` (32px)
- `--cre8-font-family-base` - Body font
- `--cre8-font-family-heading` - Heading font

### Radii
- `--cre8-radius-sm` (4px) through `--cre8-radius-full` (9999px)

### Shadows
- `--cre8-shadow-sm` / `md` / `lg`

## Best Practices

1. **Use semantic components** - Choose `cre8-heading` over raw `<h1>` tags
2. **Leverage slots** - Use named slots for complex layouts
3. **Customize via CSS vars** - Don't override component styles directly
4. **Handle events** - Listen for `cre8-*` events, not native events
5. **Accessibility** - Components include ARIA attributes by default
6. **Responsive** - Use Grid and Container for responsive layouts

## REST API

Base URL: `https://a2ui-bridgecre8-mcp-production.up.railway.app`

- `GET /components` - Web components (default)
- `GET /components/:name` - Component details
- `GET /react/components` - React components
- `GET /react/components/:name` - React component details
- `GET /patterns` - UI patterns
- `GET /search?q=query` - Search
- `GET /llms.txt` - This file

## Need Help?

Use the MCP tools to explore:
1. `list_components` to see all available components
2. `get_component` with a component name for full API details
3. `search_components` to find components by keyword
4. `get_patterns` for ready-to-use UI templates
